name: Yossi Matias
content: Yossi Matias' Home Page [ research interests | projects | teaching | recent papers | publications | bio sketch | awards ] [ conferences | projects @ Bell Labs | internet privacy & anti spam | favorite music ] Prof. Yossi Matias School of Computer Science Tel Aviv University matias+www@cs.tau.ac.il Office: Schreiber building, rm 319 Currently on leave: Head of Google's R&D Center in Israel. Bio Research interests: Massive data sets, massive parallelism, data analysis, data streams, algorithms, databases, data structures, data synopses, approximate query processing, data mining, database privacy, internet privacy, spam control, search and information retrieval, parallel computation, data compression, hashing, database systems. information systems The ACM-EATCS Gödel Prize (2005) Publications Patents Recent Papers Invited talks (recent): Internet+2007 (Beijing), WADS'06 (Kanpur), ECML-PKDD'05 (Porto) Program Committees (recent): CPM'08, ESA'07, ECML-PKDD'06, SIGMOD'06, SIGMOD'06 Industrial Track, NGITS'06, KDD'06, KDDS'05, FSTTCS'05, KDD'05, WWW'05, ICDT'05, ICDE'05 (more below) Steering Committee: IAG - Israel Academic Grid Internet privacy and SPAM control (past activities): LPWA: The Lucent Personalized Web Assistant, Ad-Hoc Working Group on Unsolicited Commercial Email - Report to the FTC, W3C's report on P3P Guiding Principles, The AAAS project on Anonymous Communications on the Internet Favorite music Publications resources Recent Papers Publication list Citeseer Coauthors (from DBLP) ACM DL Google Scholar Projects at TAU InfoLab The Informatics Laboratory (InfoLab) encapsulates projects dealing with various aspects of information processing. Most notably, my InfoLab projects deal with effective processing of massive data sets. They include the following: Leonardo: sketches and synopses τ-synopses: a system for run-time management of remote synopses Profiler: on-the-fly run-time code profiling Memento: program reversals based on list traversal synopses IPCompress: effective compression in packet networks Sensible Sensing: adaptive probing and communication in sensor networks Hosted Projects Planet Lab @ TAU IAG -
